plan_description.value:
1. **Financial Protection**: Provides financial protection to your family in the event of the policyholder's demise.
2. **Smart Exit Benefit**: Get back all premiums paid with this benefit, which can be exercised in any policy year greater than 25, but not during the last 5 policy years.
3. **Premium Break Benefit**: Option to defer premiums by up to 12 months, applicable only after completion of 5 policy years for a maximum of 12 consecutive months at a time, with a minimum gap of 5 years between each request.
4. **Return of Premium Option**: Get back all premiums paid on survival till maturity, ensuring that the policyholder receives their investment back if they outlive the policy term.
5. **Accelerated Instant Death Benefit**: Provides an instant death benefit of ₹5 Lakhs with immediate payout on claim intimation, ensuring quick financial support to beneficiaries.

plan_options.value:
1. **Base Plan**: This is the fundamental coverage provided under the policy, ensuring life insurance protection for the policyholder. 

2. **Return of Premium Option**: This option allows the policyholder to receive a return of **100% of the Total Premiums paid** as a lump sum upon survival till maturity. This option can only be selected at policy inception and is available under specific policy term conditions: 
   - Policy term between 10 and 40 years for Regular Pay and 5 Pay. 
   - Policy term between 15 and 40 years for 10 Pay. 
   - Policy term between 20 and 40 years for Premium Paying Term – 15 years. 
   An additional premium is required for this option, and once chosen, the policyholder cannot opt out of this benefit.

3. **Renewability Option at Maturity**: This option allows the policyholder to renew the policy upon maturity, ensuring continued coverage without the need to reapply for a new policy.

death_benefit_payment_option.value:
1. **Death Benefit**: The death benefit is payable as a lump sum if the life assured dies during the policy term. It is the highest of the following options:
   - **Basic Sum Assured**: The amount of sum assured chosen by the policyholder.
   - **10 times the Annualized Premium**: This is calculated based on the annual premium amount payable in a year, excluding taxes and other additional premiums.
   - **105% of Total Premiums Paid**: This includes the total of all premiums received, excluding any extra premium, rider premium, and taxes.

2. **Statistical Details**:
   - **Total Premiums Paid**: ₹2,58,133
   - **Basic Sum Assured**: ₹2,00,00,000 (this is the amount paid out to the nominee on the death of the life assured during the 7th policy year).
   - **Annualized Premium**: ₹37,794 from the 2nd year onwards; ₹31,369 in the first year.

3. **Additional Options**:
   - **Smart Exit Benefit**: Get back all premiums paid after 25 years, but not during the last 5 policy years.
   - **Premium Break Benefit**: Option to defer premiums by up to 12 months after completion of 5 policy years.
   - **Return of Premium Option**: Get back all premiums paid on survival till maturity, available only at policy inception with additional premium payable.
   - **Accelerated Instant Death Benefit**: ₹5 Lakhs with immediate payout on claim intimation.

surrender_benefits.value:
1. **Surrender Benefit Calculation**: The surrender benefit is calculated as the **Surrender/Unexpired Risk Premium Value (Surrender Value)**.  
2. **Guaranteed Surrender Value (GSV)**:  
   - Acquired immediately upon payment of premium in case of **Single Pay (SP)**.  
   - Acquired after payment of premiums for at least **2 years** in case of **Limited Pay/Regular Pay**.  
3. **Special Surrender Value (SSV)**:  
   - The company may pay a surrender value higher than the GSV in the form of SSV.  
   - SSV becomes payable after completion of the **first policy year**, provided one full year premium has been received for **Limited/Regular Pay**.  
4. **Higher Value**: The surrender value will be the higher of **Guaranteed Surrender Value** or **Special Surrender Value**.  
5. **Policy Cancellation Value**:  
   - Acquired upon payment of premiums for at least **1 full year** and after completion of the first policy year in case of **Limited Pay**.  
   - In all other cases, the policy cancellation value is the **Unexpired Risk Premium value**.

paid_up_value.value:
1. **Paid-Up Value Acquisition**: A policy will acquire a **paid-up value** only if:  
   - **Return of Premium** is selected with **Limited Pay/Regular Pay**.  
   - Premiums are paid for at least **1 full year** and after completion of the **first policy year**.  

2. **Lapse Condition**: In all other cases, the policy lapses on premium discontinuance without any **paid-up value**.  

3. **Benefits if Paid-Up Value is Acquired**: If a policy has acquired a **paid-up value** and stops paying premiums:  
   (i) **Death Benefit** shall be the highest of:  
   - **Sum Assured on Death** × (Total Premiums Paid ÷ Total Premiums Payable)  
   - 105% of Total Premiums Paid  
   (ii) **Maturity Benefit** (where applicable) shall be calculated as:  
   - **Sum Assured on Maturity** × (Total Premiums Paid ÷ Total Premiums Payable)  

4. **Maturity Benefit**: On survival until maturity, **Sum Assured on Maturity** (if applicable) will be payable, which will be equal to **100% of the Total Premiums Paid**, if **Return of Premium** option is selected, **Nil** otherwise.

exit_options.value:
1. **Smart Exit Benefit**: The policyholder can receive a Smart Exit Benefit equal to the **Total Premiums Paid** under the policy. This option can be exercised in any policy year greater than 25, but not during the last 5 policy years, and the policy must be in-force at the time of exercising this option. No additional premium is payable to avail this option. This option is not available if the **Return of Premium** option has been selected.

2. **Return of Premium Option**: If selected, this option allows the policyholder to get back all premiums paid on survival till maturity. However, this option cannot be combined with the Smart Exit Benefit.

3. **Premium Break Benefit**: The policyholder has the option to defer premiums by up to **12 months** after completion of **5 policy years** for a maximum of 12 consecutive months at a time, with a minimum gap of 5 years between each request.

4. **Renewability Option at Maturity**: At maturity, the policyholder can choose to extend the term of their policy. The additional premium payable for the extended term will be based on the attained age at the time of renewability and the chosen increase in policy term. This option is available only if the **Premium Payment Term** is **Regular Pay** and the **Return of Premium** option is not selected.

5. **Immediate Payout on Claim Intimation**: In case of the death of the life assured, post completion of the waiting period, an accelerated instant death benefit of ₹5 Lakhs is provided with immediate payout on claim intimation.

1. **HDFC Life Income Benefit on Accidental Disability Rider**: This rider provides a benefit equal to **1% of Rider Sum Assured per month** for the next **10 years** in the event of an **Accidental Total Permanent Disability**. There is **no maturity benefit** available under this rider.

2. **HDFC Life Protect Plus Rider**: This rider offers a benefit as a proportion of the **Rider Sum Assured** in case of **accidental death** or **partial/total disability**. It is categorized as a **Non-Linked, Non-Participating/Participating, Pure risk premium, Individual Life/Health rider**.

3. **HDFC Life Health Plus Rider**: This rider provides a **lump sum benefit** equivalent to the **Rider Sum Assured** if the **Life Assured** is diagnosed with any of the covered disabilities or any of the **covered 60 Critical Illnesses**. It is also a **Non-Linked, Non-Participating/Participating, Pure risk premium, Individual Health rider**.
